embeds.title: __How to Moderate__
embeds.description: Before you search for guidelines make sure you take into account that **every situation has a context that has to be taken into account**

fields.name: 1 - Minor misbehavior/Rule infringement
fields.value: Ask them politely to stop doing that or to change the topic. If they become combative proceed to situation 2. These situation doesn't need to be archived.

fields.name: 2 - Major rule infringement
fields.value:
Proceed to mute them with <<<<@204255221017214977>>>> and talk to them in #decompressing (1, 2 or 3). Make sure they have complied to the rules they broke.
If they do, unmute them.
If they don't after several warnings, ban them.
If they don't respond in 24h at any given point of the conversation, ban them with appeal

fields.name: 3 - Punctual infringement
fields.value: If a past action has been deemed as a rule infringement, you warn them through DMs. No need to mute. If they get combative then follow procedure 2.

fields.name: 4 - Emotional Outburst
fields.value: If a member is having breakdown or is highly emotionally charged then mute the member and proceed to talk with them in #decompressing (1, 2 or 3). Feel free to ping Head Support in #moderation to ask for guidance when managing the person. The objective is to deescalate the situation and help them calm down. Once its done tell them to ping mod after they have calmed down and unmute them

fields.name: 5 - Suicidal person in a public channel (#venting not included)
fields.value: If a user is being suicidal then we proceed to mute them and provide them with the proper hotlines to seek for help. We are NOT trained to deal with suicidal people so **don't try to create a support session**.
